meanings.definition: To breathe abnormally fast and deep
meanings.sent1: After running for a long time, he was hyperventilating heavily.
meanings.sent2: She started hyperventilating during the intense workout.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character was hyperventilating comically after running in circles.
meanings.sent4: The engine of the car was hyperventilating as it struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The wind was so strong that it felt like nature was hyperventilating around them.

meanings.definition: Experiencing rapid and shallow breathing due to anxiety or panic
meanings.sent1: The hyperventilating puppy was scared of the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: She felt dizzy and hyperventilating after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The hyperventilating squirrel looked around nervously for its lost acorn.
meanings.sent4: The hyperventilating crowd surged forward in excitement at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The hyperventilating student struggled to calm down before the exam.
